DataElement.preferredName: Informed Consent Less Non Cancer Normal Control Collection Date Calculated Day Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time interval in days from the date the submission sample was removed to the date of consent for the use of the submitted tissue.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Consent Subtract Non Cancer Normal Control Collection Time Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Permission to do something._The act of removing a part from the whole._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host._Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI)_The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Consent Subtraction Negation Malignant Normal Control Collection Time
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Permission to do something.:The act of removing a part from the whole.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.:Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI):The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: The act of removing a part from the whole.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.
Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created and released for TCGA per approval by T.Lichtenberg. mc 5/29/12

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Calculation created for TCGA content requested by Dr. Ari Kahn.  This VD uses a calculation of dividing a value by the number of milliseconds in a day (86,400,000) to result in a number of days, stored as a whole number.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Number of Days from Date of N
ReferenceDocuments.description: Number of Days from Date of Non-Cancer Control Sample Procurement to Date of Consent

DataElement.changeDescription: Created and released for TCGA per approval by T.Lichtenberg. mc 5/29/12
